sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Consider the figure given below. In this figure we have \(CD \parallel BG \), and \(CE \parallel BH \). Now, prove that \(DE \parallel GH \).
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
$$\text{In the triangle FGB , we have $CD \parallel BG $. So, we can write that}$$
\[
	\frac{D\input[s1v1]{} }{DG } = \frac{FC }{\input[s1v2]{}B }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
$$\text{Now, again in triangle FHB , we have $CE \parallel BH $. So, we can write}$$
\[
	\frac{FC }{CB } = \frac{F\input[s2v1]{} }{\input[s2v2]{}H }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
From the above two equations, we get
\[
	\frac{\input[s3v1]{}D }{DG } = \frac{\input[s3v2]{}E }{EH }
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Thus, in the triangle FGH we can write 
\[
	\frac{FD }{\input[s4v1]{}\input[s4v2]{}} = \frac{FE }{EH }
\]

"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "Which means $DE \parallel GH $. Hence proved.
\newline
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["F", "C"], "text": "$$\text{In the triangle FGB , we have $CD \parallel BG $, therefore, from the basic proportionality theorem $\frac{FD }{DG } = \frac{FC }{CB }$.}$$"}, {"data": ["E", "E"], "text": "$$\text{In the triangle FHB , we have $CE \parallel BH $, therefore, again using the basic proportionality theorem $\frac{FC }{CB } = \frac{FE }{EH }$.}$$ "}, {"data": ["F", "F"], "text": "$$\text{Using property, if $a = b$, and $a = c$, then $b = c$, therefore, from the above results we can write $\frac{FD }{DG } = \frac{FE }{EH }$}$$"}, {"data": ["D", "G"], "text": "$$\text{Using converse of Thale's Theorem we can say that in the triangle $FGH$, if $\frac{FD }{DG } = \frac{FE }{EH }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
